title.narrative: Advanced Implementation of SBA Framework in BIH
Advanced Implementation of SBA Framework in BiH, SBA in BiH2EU

description.narrative:
Den enskilda organisationen ”Enterprise Development Agency (Eda)” genomför för närvarande det svenskfinansierade projektet "Small Business Act and Policy Framework in BIH, SBA in BIH". Eda har till Sida ansökt om fortsatt finansiering på 16 300 000 SEK för att genomföra ett uppföljande projekt med titeln "Advanced Implementation of Small Business Act Framework i BIH2EU, SBA i BIH2EU ". Projektförslaget bygger till stor del på rekommendationer från den externa utvärderingen som nyligen genomfördes av pågående projekt. Det nya projektet kommer att genomföras under perioden 2022-2025 (tre (3) år).
Insatsen syftar till att stödja institutioner i Bosnien och Hercegovina för att påskynda den ekonomiska integrationen med EU på området små och medelstora företag (SMF) genom att skapa strategiska och politiska ramar i linje med EUs regelverk och därmed förbättra SMF: s resultat i landet. Stödet förväntas bygga kapacitet för att förbättra genomförandet av strategier och policyer för små och medelstora företags konkurrenskraft, innovation och utveckling av entreprenörskap samt alla relaterade processer i syfte att säkerställa ett samordnat och jämnt genomförande av Small Business Act i hela landet.
Den totala budgeten är 16 300 000 SEK under perioden 3 2022-2025.

Enterprise Development Agency currently implementing the project funded by Sweden "Small Business Act and Policy Framework in BIH, SBA in BIH" has applied to Sida for funding of 16 300 000 SEK to implement a project titled "Advanced Implementation of Small Business Act Framework in BIH2EU, SBA in BIH2EU". The project proposal is largely based on recommendations from the external evaluation commissioned to evaluate the above-mentioned ongoing project. The proposed project will be implemented during the period 2022- 2025 (three (3) years).
The intervention aims to support institutions in Bosnia and Herzegovina to accelerate economic integration with the EU in the field of Small and Medium Enterprises (SME) strategic and policy framework, with higher impact on performance of SMEs in the country. It is expected that intervention will introduce new instruments with appropriate capacities built to improve implementation of strategies and policies for SME competitiveness, innovation and entrepreneurship development and all related processes to ensure harmonized and even implementation of Small Business Act.
Total budget is 16, 300 000 SEK during the period of 3 (three) years 2022-2025.

The overall objective of this intervention is to support institutions in Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH) to accelerate economic integration with the EU in the field of Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) strategic and policy framework, higher impact on performance of SMEs in the country. The specific objective of the intervention is fully functional and sustainable system of SME development management in BiH based on Small Business Act (SBA) framework and Building Back Better approach ensuring continuous improvements of policies at all stages of policy development (planning and design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation, reporting and revising). The intervention will target key: - Ministries/respective departments responsible for development, implementation, M&E of SME related strategies and policies, - Related ministries, educational institutions, institutes, development agencies and Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) active in the field of SME and Entrepreneurship development, - Formal Private-Public Dialogue Promoting Structures for SME and Entrepreneurship (SME development councils, Economic councils)and Business Associations - Export - oriented and innovative SMEs, Women and Entrepreneurs Through implementation of proposed activities the project will aim to achieve following results: - Introduced new instruments with appropriate capacities built to improve operationalisation and implementation of strategies and policies for SME competitiveness/innovation and Entrepreneurship development - Introduced new instruments with appropriate capacities built to improve monitoring, learning and reporting processes and effects related to SME development strategies, policies and SBA implementation, including capacity building/preparation for evaluation - Introduced new instruments and structures to improve revision/ updating/planning/design of SME and Entrepreneurship related strategies, plans and policies with its integration into overall strategic and operational planning around the country - Improved harmonisation of policies and coordination of strategies for SME and Entrepreneurship development - Improved coordination of SME-related ministries with the Delegation of the European Union in Bosnia and Herzegovina (EUD) and other donors and increased support to SME and Entrepreneurship development from both sides

tag.narrative: 17.3 - Mobilisera additionella finansiella resurser till utvecklingsländerna från många olika källor.
17.3 - Mobilize additional financial resources for developing countries from multiple sources.

8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

9.b - Stödja inhemsk teknikutveckling, forskning och innovation i utvecklingsländerna, inklusive genom att säkerställa en gynnsam policymiljö för exempelvis industriell diversifiering och förädling av råvaror.

9.b - Support domestic technology development, research and innovation in developing countries, including by ensuring a conducive policy environment for, inter alia, industrial diversification and value addition to commodities.
